meanings.sent1: She was chiding her little brother for not finishing his homework.
meanings.sent2: The teacher often chides the students for talking in class.
meanings.sent3: The mother couldn't help but chide her mischievous puppy for chewing on her shoes.
meanings.sent4: The wind chided the leaves for not rustling loud enough.
meanings.sent5: His conscience chided him for not being honest about what happened.

meanings.sent1: His chiding of her behavior was firm but fair.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't bear the chiding from her parents after coming home late.
meanings.sent3: The playful chiding between friends lightened the mood at the party.
meanings.sent4: The chiding from the boss made him realize he needed to improve his work.
meanings.sent5: The public chiding embarrassed him in front of his colleagues.
